author: Agencias
title: Citigroup ficha a un peso pesado de JPMorgan para su ofensiva en fusiones
text:
Citigroup ficha a un peso pesado de JPMorgan para su ofensiva en fusiones
Con 27 aÃ±os de trayectoria en JPMorgan, Baygual asumirÃ¡ el cargo el prÃ³ximo mes de septiembre, con base en Londres
Guillermo Baygual, veterano de JPMorgan y hasta ahora codirector global del Ã¡rea de infraestructuras y fondos estratÃ©gicos del mayor banco de EEUU, ha fichado por Citigroup como codirector global de Fusiones y Adquisiciones (M&A).
Baygual, con 27 aÃ±os de trayectoria en JPMorgan, asumirÃ¡ el cargo el prÃ³ximo mes de septiembre, con base en Londres, y compartirÃ¡ responsabilidades globales con Drago Rajkovic, cuyo nombramiento tambiÃ©n fue reciente.
Desde Citi subrayan que el fichaje refuerza su ofensiva en banca de inversiÃ³n: â€œGuillermo es un banquero excepcional con mÃ¡s de tres dÃ©cadas de experiencia liderando equipos globales tanto en M&A como en cobertura de banca de inversiÃ³n", apuntan desde la entidad dirigida por Jane Fraser.
El ejecutivo ha liderado numerosas operaciones de calado en el universo de infraestructuras y fondos de capital privado, dos segmentos que se han mantenido especialmente activos a pesar del parÃ³n generalizado en las grandes transacciones.
Guillermo Baygual, veterano de JPMorgan y hasta ahora codirector global del Ã¡rea de infraestructuras y fondos estratÃ©gicos del mayor banco de EEUU, ha fichado por Citigroup como codirector global de Fusiones y Adquisiciones (M&A).

author: Importer
title: Amygdala Neurosciences Selects ANS-858 for Clinical Development as a Novel ALDH2 Inhibitor for Substance Use Disorder | finanzen.net
text:
Home Aktien Amygdala Neurosciences Selects ANS-858 for Clinical Development as a Novel ALDH2 Inhibitor for Substance Use Disorder Werbung "600% Momentum-Strategie": Aktien hebeln und Gewinne maximieren - sichern Sie sich jetzt das Kennenlernangebot fÃ¼r nur 39 Euro (statt 69 Euro) im Monat! Amygdala Neurosciences Selects ANS-858 for Clinical Development as a Novel ALDH2 Inhibitor for Substance Use Disorder 02.04.25 23:39 Uhr Werbung The discovery and preclinical efficacy of ANS-858, a proprietary, selective, reversible, orally bioavailable ALDH2 inhibitor will be presented at 48 th Annual Scientific Meeting of the Research Society on Alcohol.
SAN FRANCISCO , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Amygdala Neurosciences, Inc., a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the research and development of novel therapies for addiction and compulsive overeating disorders, has announced a significant milestone in its drug development pipeline. The company has selected ANS-858 as its lead clinical candidate. This marks a crucial step forward in bringing a potentially transformative treatment to patients suffering from these debilitating conditions.
ANS-858 is a new, proprietary, small molecule inhibitor of aldehyde dehydrogenase 2 (ALDH2). By inhibiting ALDH2, ANS-858 aims to reduce the rewarding effects associated with alcohol and other substances, thereby mitigating the risk of relapse and offering a path toward abstinence while also reducing anxiety.
The selection of ANS-858 follows an extensive preclinical evaluation demonstrating strong efficacy, selectivity, and a favorable safety profile. ALDH2 inhibition represents a promising mechanism for reducing consumption of addictive drugs by affecting the mesolimbic dopamine reward pathway to reduce cravings. Unlike traditional therapies, ANS-858 is designed to provide greater tolerability, improved dosing flexibility, and optimized pharmacokinetics.
"Amygdala Neurosciences is committed to advancing the treatment landscape for substance use disorder, a condition with significant unmet medical need," said Brent K Blackburn, PhD, CEO. "The selection of ANS-858 for clinical development marks a key milestone in our mission to develop safe and effective therapeutics for individuals struggling with SUD. Our team is preparing to initiate first-in-human clinical trials to evaluate ANS-858's potential in reducing addictive drug consumption and promoting recovery."
One in five adult Americans, or 48 million people, have a diagnosis of a substance use disorder. Alcohol use disorder affects over 28 million adults in the United States , yet current treatment options remain limited. There are 1.2 million patients with cocaine use disorder, where no medical treatment options are available. ANS-858 is designed to provide a targeted, pharmacological approach to modulating dopamine biosynthesis in the brain without affecting basal levels, offering a novel alternative to existing therapies.
Amygdala Neurosciences plans to submit an Investigational New Drug (IND) application to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and advance ANS-858 into Phase 1 clinical trial.
Amygdala Neurosciences to present at the Research Society on Alcohol.
The Annual Scientific Meeting of the Research Society on Alcohol (RSA) aims to bring together alcohol researchers from various disciplines to share their latest findings and stay updated on new research developments. It fosters both professional and personal interactions in a collaborative environment. The meeting is being held in New Orleans, LA , June 21-25, 2025 .
About ANS-858
ANS-858, a proprietary new chemical entity, works in the brain's 'neural interface between motivation and action' to reduce the dopamine surge responsible for craving. Inhibition of ALDH2 has been shown to reduce drug seeking behavior in preclinical studies against multiple addictive agents and has the potential for use as pharmacotherapy for substance use disorders (SUD), binge-eating, and anxiety. Amygdala Neurosciences is developing ANS-858 for the safe treatment of SUD that includes alcohol and cocaine use disorders.
About Amygdala Neurosciences, Inc .
Amygdala Neurosciences is developing ANS-858 to curb craving. Its mission is to treat individuals who experience harmful cravings associated with chemicals of addiction and food. The company was formed based on technology discovered and developed by members of the companies' leadership team while at CV Therapeutics and acquired from Gilead Sciences.
Research reported in this press release was supported by the National Institute On Alcohol Abuse And Alcoholism of the National Institutes of Health under Award Numbers U43AA030689 and R43AA029311. The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health.
http://www.amygns.com

SOURCE Amygdala Neurosciences Inc.

author: Romina Fiadino
title: Las planchas no van mÃ¡s; estos son los 4 ejercicios de Pilates ideales para un abdomen plano y definido
text:
Vida fitness
Las planchas no van mÃ¡s; estos son los 4 ejercicios de Pilates ideales para un abdomen plano y definido
Incorpora estos movimientos a tu rutina de entrenamiento para tonificar tu abdomen en poco tiempo.Para tener un[ abdomen plano y definido ](https://www.terra.com/estilo-de-vida/2024/7/20/adios-planchas-este-es-el-ejercicio-definitivo-para-definir-tu-abdomen-19283.html)es necesario llevar a cabo un entrenamiento constante con ejercicios especÃ­ficos para la zona. Sin embargo, muchos de esos ejercicios suelen ser desgastante y difÃ­ciles, lo que te hace abandonar la rutina en menos de una semana.
Para evitar eso, te develaremos 4 [ejercicios de Pilates](https://www.terra.com/estilo-de-vida/2024/10/12/el-sencillo-ejercicio-de-pilates-ideal-para-fortalecer-tu-abdomen-despues-de-los-40-22240.html) fÃ¡ciles de hacer y muy prÃ¡cticos para tonificar el abdomen. Ten en cuenta que debes realizarlos de forma controlada para que los mÃºsculos trabajen de manera profunda. Con esta rutina mejorarÃ¡s tu rendimiento deportivo y podrÃ¡s disfrutar de un abdomen plano y definido. Descubre cÃ³mo hacerlos correctamente para evitar lesiones.
Ejercicios de Pilates para fortalecer el abdomen
RotaciÃ³n lateral
Para este ejercicio te colocaras en posiciÃ³n de plancha con los antebrazos en el suelo y el codo alineado con el hombro. Pon las manos juntas y mantÃ©n el cuerpo recto. Manteniendo tu core activo, coloca tu peso sobre un antebrazo y levanta la otra mano del suelo. Gira la posiciÃ³n lateralmente, deteniÃ©ndote en la posiciÃ³n de plancha lateral con el brazo extendido hacia arriba. Vuelve a la posiciÃ³n inicial girando hacia abajo y repite del otro lado. Debes hacer 15 repeticiones en total.
Cien
Para este ejercicio deberÃ¡s recostarte en el suelo boca arriba con las piernas extendidas y elevadas a 45Â° grados. Levanta la cabeza y los hombros, y comienza a inhalar y exhalar. Con la palma de la mano hacia abajo, realiza movimientos con los brazos extendidos y pegados al cuerpo, imaginando que mueves el aire hacia arriba. Debes hacer 100 respiraciones.
Plancha inversa
Es un ejercicio perfecto para los abdominales. Para ello, siÃ©ntate en el suelo, apoya los brazos y mantenlos extendidos alineando manos con los hombros. Estira las piernas apoyando solo el talÃ³n. Tu cara y cuerpo deben estar mirando hacia arriba. MantÃ©n tu core activo y flexiona una rodilla acercÃ¡ndola a tu torso. Repite el movimiento con la otra pierna y haz este ejercicio por al menos 30 segundos.
Levantamiento de piernas cruzado
Parte de una posiciÃ³n boca arriba con las piernas dobladas a 90 grados del suelo. MantÃ©n la cabeza y los hombros levantados, y manos detrÃ¡s del cuello con los codos abiertos. Luego, exhala llevando el codo derecho hacia la rodilla opuesta, manteniendo la pierna a 90 grados.. La otra pierna se extiende hacia adelante. Inhala y cuando exhales repite alternando piernas y brazos. Realiza 15 repeticiones de este ejercicio.
Con estos son los 4 ejercicios de Pilates podrÃ¡s tener un abdomen plano y definido en muy poco tiempo. Â¿QuÃ© esperas para practicar esta rutina?

author: William
title: â€˜Mini tornadoâ€™ sweeps across Brisbane River as Queensland is battered by wild thunderstorms and huge hail
text:
Queensland is hit by heavy storms By Eliza Mcphee for Daily Mail Australia
Published: 03:08 EDT, November 1, 2024 | Updated: 03:25 EDT, November 1, 2024
A mini-twister has been filmed ripping through Brisbane amid wild weather, bringing severe thunderstorms and massive hail to parts of Queensland.
The gust, a small twister different from that of a tornado, was spotted on the Brisbane River at Kangaroo Point on Friday afternoon amid dangerous winds and heavy rain.
The weather phenomenon was captured by Channel Seven weather presenter Tony Auden.
â€œFrom what I can tell, this is not a full-fledged tornado, but more likely a â€˜gustnadoâ€™ which is a more transient feature on the leading edge of the storm. It still looked like there was a strong wind!â€™ he wrote on X.
Several weather warnings are in force for eastern parts of the state, including a severe thunderstorm warning for parts of Gympie, the Sunshine Coast and Moreton Bay regions.
Residents are told to expect damaging winds and hailstones up to 3 inches wide.
â€œA moist and unstable air mass combined with a south-easterly wind shift moving along the coast is leading to the development of severe thunderstorms in south-east Queensland,â€ the Bureau of Meteorology said.
â€œSevere thunderstorms are likely to produce damaging winds and large hailstones across parts of the Wide Bay, Burnett and Southeast Coast districts over the next few hours.â€
The BOM said hailstones as large as 3 inches in diameter were spotted at Flagstone, in Logan, just after 3pm on Friday.
Thereâ€™s more to come
Twister on the Brisbane River!!! ðŸŒªï¸
As far as I can tell, this is not a full-fledged tornado, but more likely a â€œgustnadoâ€ which is a more transient feature on the leading edge of the storm.
Still, it looked like there was a strong wind in it!
Credit: Hayden Oakley pic.twitter.com/SD6V8GoU5T
â€” Tony Auden (@TonyAuden) November 1, 2024
The gust, a small twister different from that of a tornado, was spotted on the Brisbane River at Kangaroo Point on Friday afternoon amid dangerous winds and heavy rain.
Heavy thunderstorms hit Brisbane on Friday
Huge hailstones lashed parts of south-east Queensland on Friday

author: KSL SPORTS
title: Team U.S.A. Rugby Sevens Gets Shutout By Australia In Quarter-Finals
text:
Team U.S.A. Rugby Sevens Gets Shutout By Australia In Quarter-Finals
Jul 25, 2024, 3:06 PM
PARIS, France â€“ After picking up its first win over Uruguay earlier in the day, Team U.S.A. Rugby Sevens lost to Australia in the quarter-finals.
The U.S. was outmatched from the jump. It felt like every time they made a mistake, Australia immediately capitalized.
A comprehensive win for
[@Aussie7s]Men sees them into their first Olympic semi-final ðŸ™Œ [#RugbySevens]| [#Paris2024] [pic.twitter.com/utftCE3iEQ]
â€” Rugby Sevens (@SVNSSeries)
[July 25, 2024]
U.S. Rugby Sevens Shut Out By Australia
The start of the game was very competitive.
Neither side was able to make much progress with the ball as defense told the story early in the first half.
RELATED: Every Utah Local That Will Compete At 2024 Paris Olympics
Finally, after four minutes, Australia broke the drought. James Turner touched the ball down in the in-goal area to take a 5-0 lead.
The U.S. still held strong and looked to go into halftime trailing by just five. However, a costly turnover just before the break allowed Australia to double its lead before the break.
Bad end of the first half for the United States. Turning it over and then Australia scores to end the half with a 10-0 lead.
Downâ€¦ but not out.
[#RugbySevens] [#USAEagles] [#Paris2024]
â€” Sam Farnsworth (@Samsworth_TV)
[July 25, 2024]
The second half played out almost exactly like the first.
Team USA and Australia went back and forth with neither side able to threaten a score.
Then, after six minutes, Australia tacked on three points after a U.S. penalty.
RELATED: Salt Lake City Officially Named Host For 2034 Winter Olympics
A minute later, they secured their win with a last-minute try from Maurice Longbottom.
With the 18-0 loss, Team USA is no longer in medal contention.
Follow The 2024 Summer Olympics With KSL Sports
The
2024 Paris Olympics takes place Friday, July 26, through Sunday, August 11. The Paris Games are comprised of 329 events across 19 days, with 754 competitions and ceremonies for more than 10,000 athletes. Find KSL Sports coverage of the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics here.
Chandler Holt is a co-host of the
 Jazz Notes podcast, a Locals In The NFL Insider, and Digital Sports Producer for KSLSports.com. Follow Chandler on Twitter @CHoltSports or on Threads @chandlerho1t.
Want more coverage of Team U.S.A. Rugby Sevens? Take us with you, wherever you go.
Download the new & improved KSL Sports app from Utahâ€™s sports leader. You can stream live radio, video and stay up to date on all of your favorite teams.

author: jonolulu
title: #5 Jornadas de 17 horas y hacinamiento: las condiciones de los temporeros en la empresa de un lÃ­der de Vox en Balears
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
â€œSÃ© que me puede perjudicar porque igual no dan una buena referencia de mÃ­ y el aÃ±o que vieneâ€¦ Pero quiero que se dÃ© a conocer la realidad, que las nuevas personas que vengan no tengan que estrellarse contra el muro con el que nos damos nosotros â€, asume Fernando. Su nombre es falso porque, de otra forma, su historia no podrÃ­a contarse. La historia de las condiciones en las que viven y trabajan los temporeros de Terracor que han contado su vivencia a elDiario.es. Este conglomerado mallorquÃ­n estÃ¡ formado por seis empresas dedicadas al cultivo y venta de frutas y verduras. En su organigrama figuran cinco socios. Uno de ellos, el secretario general de Vox en Balears y el conseller del Consell de Mallorca, Toni Gili.
A 8.000 kilÃ³metros de su paÃ­s y sin mÃ¡s contactos que sus propios compaÃ±eros, la mayorÃ­a se sienten atrapados en un panorama que no saben muy bien cÃ³mo resolver. â€œAlgunos hemos pedido un aumento de sueldo que se nos ha denegado, y tambiÃ©n hemos hablado con asociaciones de colombianos aquÃ­ para que nos puedan echar una mano, pero por el momento no ha habido ninguna mejoraâ€, afirma otro de los afectados.
La realidad que explican los temporeros de Terracor es que las condiciones no son halagÃ¼eÃ±as: segÃºn su versiÃ³n, su salario ronda los 6 euros la hora y en sus jornadas lo â€œnormalâ€ es que trabajan doce horas. En el cuadrante del mes de mayo que uno de los empleados muestra a elDiario.es figuran tambiÃ©n jornadas de 13, 14 e incluso 17 horas. En las nÃ³minas consultadas no aparecen horas extra remuneradas.
El Ministerio de InclusiÃ³n, Seguridad Social y Migraciones, en cuanto ha tenido conocimiento de los hechos, a travÃ©s de su SecretarÃ­a de Estado de Migraciones, ha accionado. En coordinaciÃ³n con la DelegaciÃ³n del Gobierno en Balears, ha localizado a la empresa y, una vez realizado este trÃ¡mite, ha notificado la denuncia a InspecciÃ³n de Trabajo para que acuda y realice la visita pertinente de cara a, en su caso, depurar responsabilidades.
elDiario.es ha intentado ponerse en contacto con Toni Gili antes de la publicaciÃ³n de este reportaje, pero el polÃ­tico ha derivado la consulta a la responsable de comunicaciÃ³n del grupo, quien ha especificado que el aÃ±o pasado la empresa superÃ³ una inspecciÃ³n en los alojamientos de los temporeros, pero no ha sabido concretar quÃ© organismo se encargÃ³ de dicha inspecciÃ³n ni cuÃ¡les fueron las instalaciones revisadas. â€œLos trabajadores no tienen ningÃºn lujo, es cierto, pero cumplimos la normativaâ€, aÃ±ade esta persona. Tampoco ha podido proporcionar informaciÃ³n sobre las condiciones laborales ni las jornadas de trabajo actuales de los empleados. â€œEl problema en Balears es que coincide la temporada alta turÃ­stica con la agrÃ­cola y eso hace que la competencia por los trabajadores sea muy fuerteâ€, explicaba en un reportaje anterior Gili , ingeniero tÃ©cnico agrÃ­cola y responsable de InnovaciÃ³n y ProducciÃ³n de la compaÃ±Ã­a.
Alojamiento precario y sin higiene.
A mediodÃ­a, el sol de agosto cae a plomo sobre la carretera de Manacor. Una recta casi infinita de asfalto flanqueada por campos en los que destaca un invernadero blanco con el logo de Terracor. Debajo, una frase: â€œAgricultura de aquÃ­, del dÃ­aâ€. Lo que se levanta detrÃ¡s -uno dirÃ­a que estratÃ©gicamente escondida- es precisamente una de las dos instalaciones en las que la empresa aloja a sus temporeros. â€œLa primera vez que vine, hace ya casi veinte aÃ±os, sÃ­ me sorprendÃ­. Ahora yaâ€¦â€, reconoce uno de los trabajadores antes de encogerse de hombros.
Entre invernaderos de hortalizas y plantas aromÃ¡ticas se levanta una gran nave de piedra. En el lateral el hueco del antiguo portÃ³n da paso a una suerte de salÃ³n tan precario como los suelos y paredes sin acabar. MÃ¡s al fondo, sobre un suelo ya embaldosado, se llega a la cocina ya la sucesiÃ³n de fogones y estantes que guardan la comida y enseres de las 28 personas que viven aquÃ­. Algunas, trabajadoras permanentes de la empresa.
Las habitaciones estÃ¡n del otro lado, donde la nave adquiere mÃ¡s el aspecto de una antigua casa mallorquina de campo y conserva aÃºn parte del encalado de sus paredes. AllÃ­ donde habÃ­a espacio se ha colocado una cama. Incluso en el antiguo salÃ³n. Las habitaciones compartidas se suceden a uno y otro lado. Algunas con la puerta abierta porque es la Ãºnica ventilaciÃ³n que tienen, otras con las ventanas tapiadas por paneles de madera. En una de ellas aÃºn duermen quienes han cubierto el turno nocturno: desde las seis de la tarde hasta las seis de la maÃ±ana para preparar los pedidos de los hoteles.
Todo el conjunto tiene un aspecto destartalado. Los socios de la empresa lo conocen bien. Hace apenas veinte minutos que Toni Gili se ha marchado. Los cables cuelgan de las vigas, las columnas que sostienen el inmenso porche estÃ¡n agrietadas y carcomidas. Bajo su techo conviven lavadoras, sillas, extintores y carteles que indican que estÃ¡ prohibido fumar. AquÃ­ y allÃ¡ se acumulan cajas vacÃ­as de fruta, bidones de Repsol y garrafas con los productos utilizados en los invernaderos, algunos de los cuales son a escasos metros de las habitaciones. AdemÃ¡s de la decena de sacos de basura amontonados junto al muro exterior, otro de los espacios en peor estado es un cobertizo en el que tambiÃ©n se ha habilitado un dormitorio junto a una maraÃ±a de cables, tuberÃ­as, mangueras y hierros de mÃ¡s de un metro. de altura.
â€œCuando nos contratan nos dicen que tendremos alojamiento, pero no cÃ³mo serÃ¡. Luego cuando llegas tampoco eliges si en la casa o en los contenedores, pero todos pagamos lo mismo: 80 euros al mesâ€, cuenta estÃ¡s uno de los temporeros. Una cantidad que la empresa les descuenta directamente de la nÃ³mina y que le supone unos ingresos mensuales de 2.240 euros sÃ³lo con estas instalaciones. TambiÃ©n incluye los servicios de electricidad y agua, de hecho tambiÃ©n tienen agua corriente, â€œpero no es apta para el consumoâ€, nos dicen.
â€œYo no vivo asÃ­ en mi paÃ­s, yo tengo una casa, pero no estÃ¡ tan mal. Al final se trata de no gastar mucho y poder mandar a casa todo el dinero posibleâ€, cuenta una trabajadora. Algunos se han asomado al mercado inmobiliario de Mallorca -donde la media del alquiler supera ya los 1.400 euros- y han vuelto horrorizados y aÃºn mÃ¡s resignados. Por un lado, la crisis de la vivienda hace prÃ¡cticamente imposible plantearse cualquier alternativa. Por otro, para quienes han llegado amparados por la orden del Ministerio de InclusiÃ³n, Seguridad Social y Migraciones, que regula la gestiÃ³n colectiva de contrataciones en origen, la â€œpuesta a disposiciÃ³n del trabajador de un alojamiento adecuadoâ€ es una de las obligaciones del empresario. . Un alojamiento que debe cumplir, dice el artÃ­culo 2, las condiciones de â€œhabitabilidad e higiene adecuadasâ€. Su cumplimiento, aÃ±ade, â€œpodrÃ¡ ser objeto de certificaciÃ³n y/o verificaciÃ³nâ€. Pero entre la temporada 2023 y la 2024 no hay constancia oficial de que alguien haya inspeccionado las instalaciones de Terracor.
Otro de Vox que se salta la ley a la torera y parece que vive en otra Ã©poca, porque el retraso es importante, vale, Â¿cuÃ¡l es la noticia? porque ese mamÃ³n va a seguir teniendo explotaciones agrÃ­colas aunque sea un esclavista y a pesar de que le pillasen.
Sinceramente, esperaba algo mejor. Mis amigos se postularon para otros puestos en EspaÃ±a y llegaron antesâ€, relata otro de los temporeros. Las fotografÃ­as que le enviaron cuando Ã©l aÃºn estaba en Colombia eran las de un apartamento â€œnormalâ€ compartido. Aquello le animÃ³ a dar el paso. TenÃ­a experiencia en el campo y pasar nueve meses en una isla del MediterrÃ¡neo no sonaba mal. Su intenciÃ³n era conseguir dinero para poder volver a la Universidad â€“tuvo que abandonar Medicina por falta de recursos- y ayudar tambiÃ©n a su hermana a pagar los estudios. â€œAl llegar vi que todo era diferente, pero no me planteÃ© irme. En Colombia decimos 'ya que metimos las patas, metamos tambiÃ©n el cuerpoâ€, recuerda.
Ã‰l es uno de los chicos de los contenedores. Desde hace meses comparte una caseta prefabricada con otras dos personas. La literatura, la cama, la taquilla y el armario plegable apenas dejan espacio para moverse. La orden del Ministerio seÃ±ala que â€œes recomendableâ€ que el â€œespacio total habitable del dormitorio alcance un mÃ­nimo de 3,5 metros cuadrados por personaâ€. â€œMe dio vergÃ¼enza contÃ¡rselo a mis amigos. No les enviÃ© ninguna foto y sÃ³lo les dije que las condiciones no eran muy aptas. A mi madre ni de chiste le cuentoâ€, afirma. Ã‰sa es la confesiÃ³n mÃ¡s extendida entre sus compaÃ±eros: que la familia no sepa, no se preocupe.
AdemÃ¡s del suyo, otra media docena de contenedores prefabricados se reparten por el terreno. Incluso la caseta en la que aÃºn cuelga el rÃ³tulo de â€œoficinaâ€ aloja ahora a dos trabajadores. En otra se acumulan neveras, hornillos y bombonas de butano en una suerte de segunda cocina. MÃ¡s alejado, un nuevo mÃ³dulo hace las veces de baÃ±o, segÃºn explican, para los chicos senegaleses. Un baÃ±o de cortinas raÃ­das, desagÃ¼es atorados y moho. El infierno en el paraÃ­so del turismo.
La situaciÃ³n de los temporeros de Terracor sale a la luz despuÃ©s de que elDiario.es dedicara un reportaje a los temporeros colombianos que desde hace aÃ±os llegan a Mallorca para salvar la temporada agrÃ­cola ante la falta de mano de obra local . SÃ³lo en los dos Ãºltimos aÃ±os, entre 400 y 500 ciudadanos de este paÃ­s han desembarcado en la isla de la mano de UniÃ³ de Pagesos, Asaja y empresas particulares para dedicarse a la recolecciÃ³n y distribuciÃ³n de frutas y hortalizas. Junto a ellos, recorren los campos y los invernaderos otros tantos trabajadores de Senegal o RumanÃ­a, algunos de ellos con contratos permanentes.
Constituido en 2017, Terracor Grup tiene su sede principal en Manacor, aunque trabaja mÃ¡s de 305 hectÃ¡reas tanto en este municipio como en Petra, Felanitx y Porreres. Entre sus principios estÃ¡n el â€œcompromiso muy firme con el respeto por nuestra tierraâ€ y el medio ambiente, y uno de sus eslÃ³ganes principales es â€œdemocratitzam lo rural per a que tota Mallorca ho disfrutiâ€ (â€œdemocratizamos lo rural para que toda Mallorca lo disfruteâ€, en castellano). A travÃ©s de sus seis marcas, no sÃ³lo se dedica al cultivo y comercializaciÃ³n de fruta y verdura, sino que tambiÃ©n cuenta con su propio restaurante -con vistas a uno de sus invernaderos- y organiza â€œexperiencias agrÃ­colas y gastronÃ³micasâ€ para locales y turistas.
En 2022 la empresa inaugurÃ³ su nuevo centro agrÃ­cola en la finca de Sa Teulera (Petra), desde donde comercializan hasta 8 millones de kilos de producto local al aÃ±o. AdemÃ¡s de colaborar con diversas entidades pÃºblicas y privadas de Mallorca, asÃ­ como con ONG, en 2021 recibiÃ³ el premio BBVA a los Mejores Productores Sostenibles.

author: gqlshare
title: 10 Norfolk schools recommended for closure in preliminary plan
text:
NORFOLK â€” A consultant tasked with developing a plan to close and consolidate 10 of the cityâ€™s public schools has created a preliminary list of properties to shutter.
In documents obtained by The Virginian-Pilot, engineering consultant Woolpert has developed a list of schools to close. The list, which will be presented at two community engagement meetings Thursday, has been created as the Norfolk City Council has directed the Norfolk School Board to create a plan to close and consolidate 10 schools or risk punitive action.
The preliminary list of schools set for closure:
Ghent School Tarrallton Elementary School Willoughby Early Childhood Center P. B. Young Sr. Elementary School Lindenwood Elementary School Granby Elementary School Berkley Campostella Early Childhood Education Center Norview Elementary School The Southeastern Cooperative Educational Programs Center Norfolk Technical Center The city mandate to close schools comes as student enrollment in Norfolk has been on a steady decline. It has dropped by 22% since 2010, from 31,176 students to a projected 24,459 students in 2025, according to a recent City Council resolution.
The consultant also recommends rebuilding Maury High School, which already is in the works , as well as Suburban Park Elementary School and Jacox Elementary School.
Monroe Elementary School, Oceanair Elementary School, St. Helena Elementary School, Chesterfield Elementary School and Lake Taylor High School would be repurposed under the plan to accommodate students of various closed schools and programs.
The consultant considered the condition of school buildings and their location relative to similar nearby schools and student population density when developing the list, according to a presentation provided to the Pilot.
According to the presentation, the average age of Norfolk Public Schoolsâ€™ 49 facilities is 55 years old, 6 years older than the national average and 11 years older than the average in the Southeast.
Norfolk City Council has asked the School Board to create a plan by August to close and consolidate at least 10 schools or risk restrictions to how it can use city funding.
A media representative for Norfolk Public Schools did not respond to a request for comment Wednesday.
The discussion about school closures comes amid turmoil within school system leadership. The Norfolk School Board fired Superintendent Sharon Byrdsong in a divided vote June 11. Byrdsong criticized School Board members over what she said were efforts to undermine her administration in a May memo obtained by the Pilot.
The community engagement meetings about the school closures will be held at 1 p.m. Thursday at Booker T. Washington High School and 5 p.m. at Granby High School.
Trevor Metcalfe, 757-222-5345, trevor.metcalfe@pilotonline.com

organizations.name: Ghent School Tarrallton Elementary School Willoughby Early Childhood Center

author: @12OnYourSide
title: 9-year-old girl dies after being left in hot car while mother worked, authorities say
text:
9-year-old girl dies after being left in hot car while mother worked, authorities say
GALENA PARK, Texas (KHOU) - A 9-year-old Texas girl is dead after her mother allegedly left her alone in a car for eight hours while she went to work.
Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez says a 9-year-old girl was found unresponsive Tuesday in a car at a Galena Park industrial complex near where her 36-year-old mother works at a manufacturing plant.
â€œIâ€™m extremely upset and disappointed that a child, a 9-year-old, beautiful little girl, has lost her life by no fault of her own,â€ Gonzalez said.
He says the girlâ€™s mother knowingly left her daughter in the car when her shift began around 6 a.m. The 9-year-old had some water, and the car windows were cracked. When the motherâ€™s shift ended around 2 p.m., she found her daughter unresponsive. The girl was rushed to the hospital, where she was pronounced dead.
â€œThe mother knew and left her in the vehicle with some water, a window partially lowered and went to work,â€ Gonzalez said. â€œItâ€™s not worth it to put a child at risk like this for any particular reason.â€
The girlâ€™s mother was detained and taken in for questioning. Itâ€™s unclear yet if she will face charges.
USG, the company that owns the property, confirmed there was a medical emergency involving the child of an employee, saying in a statement, â€œOur thoughts are with the family of the child and all those impacted.â€
Safety advocates say thereâ€™s no safe amount of time to leave a child alone in a vehicle, and cracking the windows will not make the air cooler.
â€œA car can heat up, especially in the summertime, in a matter of minutes to a temperature that can cause brain damage and other health-related issues. Literally, in minutes, the car could be at a fatal temperature,â€ said Sue Auriemma with Kids and Car Safety.
Anyone who sees a child or pet left inside a vehicle alone is encouraged to call 911 immediately.
Copyright 2025 KHOU via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved.

author: Benzinga
title: Bitcoin Influencers Predict ETF Journey: It'll Be Slow 'Until You Turn Around And See BTC Up At $500K' By Benzinga
text:
Bitcoin Influencers Predict ETF Journey: It'll Be Slow 'Until You Turn Around And See BTC Up At $500K' BTC/USD +0.10% Add to/Remove from a Portfolio Add to Watchlist Add Position Position added successfully to:
Please name your holdings portfolio Type: BUY SELL Date: Amount: Price Point Value: Leverage: 1:1 1:10 1:25 1:50 1:100 1:200 1:400 1:500 1:1000 Commission: Create New Watchlist Create Create a new holdings portfolio Add Create + Add another position Close BLK -0.43% Add to/Remove from a Portfolio Add to Watchlist Add Position Position added successfully to:
Please name your holdings portfolio Type: BUY SELL Date: Amount: Price Point Value: Leverage: 1:1 1:10 1:25 1:50 1:100 1:200 1:400 1:500 1:1000 Commission: Create New Watchlist Create Create a new holdings portfolio Add Create + Add another position Close Benzinga - Social influencers on X are actively preparing for the possible approval of a spot Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) ETF, an event whose timing remains uncertain.
What Happened: Founder of GlobalMacroInvestor, Raoul Pal took to X on Thursday and said, â€œIf you care whether the BTC ETF is priced in or not, your time horizon is too short. It is all noise in the grand scheme of what lies ahead. Don't f**k This Up.â€
Veteran trader, Kong Trading took to X on Friday and stated, â€œBREAKING: MULTIPLE BITCOIN SPOT ETFâ€™S TO BE APPROVED POTENTIALLY AS EARLY AS TOMORROW â€
Eleanor Terrett , Fox Business journalist and producer, states on her X platform that some amended 19b-4 filings are expected Friday, along with last-minute comments on S-1s and possible launch dates.
Emphasizing how the investor community has adapted to the ETF sector, Information Chief of Bitwise Matt Hougan states on his X platform that after spending more than a decade educating people about ETFs, thanks to the Bitcoin ETF race, everyone is talking about Authorized Participants, 19b4 applications, and cash- vs. in-kind creations.
Also Read: Spot Bitcoin ETF Debate Heats Up: 'We Have Heard Nothing To Indicate Anything But Approval'
Why Does It Matter: Matthew Sigel , head Of Digital Assets Research at VanEck, in a live session on X hosted by The Block, stated that he has heard from a source about BlackRock Inc (NYSE: BLK) being ready with $2 billion in inflows within the first week. He added that advisors do have an appetite for the spot ETF product rather than investing in Bitcoin directly.
Bloomberg analyst Eric Balchunas in the same session said that around eight to nine applications will be approved in the first batch and that the GBTC filing would likely be in the second batch of approvals.
Regarding the approval process, it is anticipated that not all the 19b-4 filings will be finalized until Jan. 10. Approval for the S-1 filings is expected to continue into the week of Jan. 16, following which the ETFs will be allowed to commence trading.
Venture Capital and X user, Adam Cochran took to his platform and said â€œI think most people are overestimating the impact of the ETF short term while underestimating it long term.â€
He added that while short-term inflows might not generate much excitement, over the course of the next year, every advisor is expected to allocate at least 1% of their clients' portfolios to an ETF linked to an asset that has delivered returns of approximately 160% in a single year.
â€œJust slow enough to make you doubt, until you turn around and see BTC up at $500k a coin and you're still sidelined waiting on a big dip.â€ Cochran added.
Read Next: 2024 Crypto Outlook: Influencers Optimistic On Bitcoin ETF, Shibarium, And Dogecoin
